intro: Hieracium pseudosilsinum, commonly known as the false silversword, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage, often with a rosette of basal leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a composite head, and bloom during the warmer months. Hieracium pseudosilsinum is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments, showcasing resilience to drought and high sunlight exposure.
